subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Any way to speed up the scanning on the 12-469?
author: Frank Sumption
full_text:
--_cc55e638-0cd0-4d4d-9da9-ea93b43963b5_
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable


 Yeah, the guy that first made the hack was giving away a chip to control =
the scan rate. I don't know if it's still available. I have one of the chip=
s, and no '469.
 
 Frank-S


To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.comFrom: leongbabe@aol=
.comDate: Thu, 3 Jan 2008 16:37:00 +0000Subject: [EVP-ITC] Any way to speed=
 up the scanning on the 12-469?




I'm still relatively new to building bo=
xes and would like to know if it's possible to speed up the scanning a bit =
on a hacked RS 12-469. Thanks,Sharon --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Frank =
Sumption <franks-boxes@...> wrote:>> > Thanks for listening. Yeah, that's t=
he problem with noise reduction methods, they tend to take out voices. I th=
ink if I used the muffled sound consistently they would talk through it tho=
ugh, the goal being to get higher level voices, and audio. The clarifier is=
 just a low pass filter that can be adjusted--just an idea.> I have some fe=
male guides that speak sometimes, and there's the seven sisters that come t=
hough sometimes, but I don't know much about that. > > Frank-S> > > To: EVP=
-ITC@...: debbie@...: Wed, 2 Jan 2008 10:33:33 -0700Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] =
The '470 mod?> > > > > Frank, Thanks for the extra instructions, it doesn't=
 sound too difficult for me so I'll give it a shot. > > By the way, I did l=
isten to your tone control clip. Since I'm new to this my comments are prob=
ably not "worth" much at this point. I thought the entire clip itself was a=
 lot smoother and clearer than most I've heard so far from various sources =
(the mixed station sounds are in smaller pieces so for someone like me it w=
ould be easier to pick out the EVPs as opposed to entire words from radio a=
nnouncers). The short piece about 2/3 of the way through, where I'm guessin=
g you used a clarifier, sounded muffled to me, which makes me think it woul=
d also muffle the EVPs. Definitely easier on the ears but for someone inexp=
erienced (and I seem to be the only one here!) it seems it would be harder =
to pick out the real words too.> > By the way, in listening to the deluge o=
f clips uploaded last night, I can't help but notice that the voices are al=
l men. Just curious -- is that always the case?> > > > > > > > > > _ _ _ _ =
_ _ _ _> > Debbie Tejada> > "Once you can accept the universe as matter exp=
anding into nothing that is something, wearing stripes with plaid comes eas=
y. " ~Albert Einstein> > On Jan 2, 2008, at 10:22 AM, Frank Sumption wrote:=
> > > > > > I have the '470, but I don't know if it's the older one or not.=
 I was able to modify it, but it was somewhat different than in the video i=
nstruction, there was more than one green wire. You have to lift the top bo=
ard so you can see the wire connections on the other board, they are labele=
d, and you can tell what wire to cut/unsolder. (mute wire). Frank-S> > Shar=
e life as it happens with the new Windows Live. Share now! > > > > > > > > =
> __________________________________________________________> Get the power=
 of Windows + Web with the new Windows Live.> http://www.windowslive.com?oc=
id=3DTXT_TAGHM_Wave2_powerofwindows_122007> 






________________________=
_________________________________________
Get the power of Windows + Web wi=
th the new Windows Live.
http://www.windowslive.com?ocid=3DTXT_TAGHM_Wave2_=
powerofwindows_122007

chip to control the scan rate. I don't know if it's still available. I=
 have one of the chips, and no '469.<BR>

 Frank-S<BR><BR><B=
